result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Ryan Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
May petition court for early discharge if Probation deems appropriate.
Consecutive to: Barron County case 16CF341
Concurrent with: 16CF119 - Count 1

miscConds.notes: $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

CASES: 14CF467 & 16CF119.  Defendant Jeffrey Ryan Butler in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Defendant Jeffrey Ryan Butler in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  1:15 p.m. AO-Clerk.  

SENTENCE:

14CF467 - i/s 3 years & 6 mo., 18 mo. IC, 2 year ES, probation up to 3 years, eligible for early discharge. $250.00 DNA sample & surcharge payable to probation.  If revoked, 12 days credit. 

16CF119 - i/s 3 years & 6 mo., 18 mo. IC, 2 year ES, probation up to 3 years, eligible for early discharge. $250.00 DNA sample & surcharge payable to probation.  If revoked, 5 days credit. 

Probations to run concurrent with each other, consecutive to Barron Co. 16CF341.  No illegal substances. 

No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
